refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para:
ideal(@MAN7EXT@) is a roff language for drawing pictures.
gideal(@MAN1EXT@) is the corresponding groff preprocessor for using this language within groff files (to be done).

refsect1.title: IDEAL PARTS
refsect1.para: Within a roff file, an ideal part is started with the command .IS.
this part is ended with the command .IE or .IF.
The text between these requests is handled by the preprocessor gideal(@MAN1EXT@).

refsect1.title: HISTORY
refsect1.para: The roff preprocessor and the roff language ideal were invented by Christopher J. Wyk in 1981 at AT&T.

The ideal language is based on complex numbers.
These are well documented at the documentation of the
Math::Complex Perl package
This documentation is more about the complex mathematics, but also a bit about related Perl examles.

refsect2.title: libfiles
refsect2.para:
libfiles are file written in ideal.
Such a file can be included into a roff file with ideal parts by the ideal command ...libfile.
A libfile can also serve as an example.
With the installation, the available libfiles will get into @DATASUBDIR@/ideal/libfiles

refsect2.title: Examples
refsect2.para: Some roff files with included ideal parts will be stored at the installation into @EXAMPLEDIR@/ideal.
